name: Red House Painters
description: '''Red House Painters''' were an American [[rock music|rock]] band formed in [[Atlanta, Georgia]] in 1988, before relocating to [[San Francisco, California]] in 1989.  Originally formed by singer-songwriter Mark Kozelek and drummer Anthony Koutsos, the pair were soon joined by guitarist Gorden Mack and bassist Jerry Vessel. Phil Carney would later replace Gorden Mack as the band's guitarist. The group released 6 studio albums and an EP, before dissolving in 2001, and are considered to be a pioneering act of the [[slowcore]] subgenre.
